data.name: #2 • The dark sock of the drawer
data.description:
**The dark sock of the drawer** (Estimated Rank : 6 kyu)

***Introduction***

It's getting cold in your house and you aren't wearing any socks. You try to turn on the heater, but you remember that there's a power cut. You go in your room to get some socks but you can't see anything.

You open your drawer but you've got a problem : you can't find any pair of socks because you can't see anything. You know that in your drawer there is 9 different colors of socks. You do some math and decide to take 10 random socks out of the drawer.

You go back in the living room with the 10 socks you took. You can see the colors because of the daylight and you find two matching socks. Problem solved !

***Task***

You will be given three arguments `num_of_c`, `num_of_soc_in_pair` and `num_of_pa_want` for the function `socks`. Yes, you can change the arguments' names.

`num_of_soc_in_pa` represents the number of sock(s) in a "pair" (you can be an alien with 11 feet). `num_of_pa_want` represents the number of "pair(s)" you want.
And finally `num_of_c` is the number of different colors you have.

Supppose you can draw an infinite amount of socks from the drawer (that must be a big drawer !). `num_of_c` and `num_of_soc_in_pa` will always be strictly positive (> 0) and `num_of_pa_want` will always be positive (>= 0).

***Examples***

``` python
socks(3, 4, 3) # Should return 18
socks(1, 1, 0) # Should return 0
```

***Good luck and have fun !***

Useless fact : the regex that matches both "The dark sock of the drawer" and "The dark side of the force" is "The dark s(ock|ide) of the (draw|forc)er?"

Other problems of [Fun Problems](https://www.codewars.com/collections/5e8e10c835ad8c000f4e237b) :
